body:
$BKKT 
The bear thesis generally seems to be that bakkt haven’t released PR to counter the massive shorting which brought the company from its recent all time high to where it is today. This is some serious nonsense The refuse to acknowledge the value in the partnerships being developed (I presume as we speak) And indicated by the mass hiring program going on - there is a potential MOASS approaching which could easily be triggered by its parent, the owner of the NYSE - So anyone right now holding a short - you may wish these points over this long weekend, and just hope the company don’t decide to annihilate your entire wealth with a PR between now and Tuesday when the market reopens. The $AAPL partnership has been mentioned in previous PR - what makes you think this won’t happen - the staff hiring program indicates it will

symbols.title: Bakkt Holdings Inc - Ordinary Shares - Class A

Now, if you asked me that question in 2018, I would say, "less," because only 960 billion household wealth then.
Now, it's upwards 2.5 TRILLION, that is what's scary, a lot of that wealth is invested in stock market so when it crashes, a lot will lose a lot of money, 401Ks, IRAs, and inflation is not going away at end of this year, not a chance.
ONLY way remote chance Inflation goes to, maybe, 4.5% by end 2022, I say, 5.5%, in present mess from Summer of Wait (Powell not raising rates, tapering JULY, because Biden strong-armed him, in fact, much like Trump 2018 when Powell was to hike. Trump was right) myself best we'll be able to finish because FED continues to purchase bonds, is to be VERY AGGRESSIVE, including 1st rate hike Feb. as well as end balance sheet, or, maybe reduce to $15B bought per month so some control.
But, IF completely cut out bonds, then can be less aggressive 1st hike, 0.50% instead of what now needs to be 0.75 to 1%

message.body: @OptionsPlayers @rattanakchea Let me say this, as an OP member for 18 months.  We do many different things, true, but they all have a common thread of learning and working together to find low risk, high probability trades week after week.  Anyone can get lucky and make a handful of winning trades.  But to do it 50 out of 52 weeks in all market conditions?  No one else comes close.
